intro: Dasysphaera prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate dasysphaera, is a low-growing flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are often brightly colored, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Dasysphaera prostrata is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
